SEARCH
Module InternationalPokemonTradeTool
Package main.java.tradingEngine.gameData.strings

Class InGameString

java.lang.Object
main.java.tradingEngine.gameData.strings.InGameString
Direct Known Subclasses:
JapaneseString, WesternString
public abstract class InGameString extends Object
A character string in a special encoding depending on the language of the game. It has a size limit of 10 useful characters since no in-game strings used in this program should be longer than that. This string always ends with an eleventh character with the value 0x50 as a delimiter, like the one used in the game. "Characters" refer to 8-bits values (stored as byte here) like it's coded in the game.
See Also:
  • WesternString
  • JapaneseString

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add(byte character)
      Adds the specified encoded character to the string.
      Parameters:
      character - the character to add, in the right encoding depending on the game
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the character is illegal for the game, or if there is no room for a new character

    • isCharacterValid

      public abstract boolean isCharacterValid(byte character)
      Checks if the specified character is legal game-wise
      Parameters:
      character - the character to check, in its numeric value
      Returns:
      true if the character is legal, false otherwise

    • addAll

      public abstract void addAll(byte[] array)
      Writes every character in the string from the specified array. The array can have a 0x50 delimiter, but that's not mandatory; if it does, the characters beyond the delimiter won't be written. The method puts a delimiter after the written area, so this effectively erases all characters present before the method call.
      Parameters:
      array - the array from which the characters are read

    • remove

      public void remove(int index)
      Removes the character at the specified index and shifts all the character after it.
      Parameters:
      index - the index where the character to remove is located
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified index is out of bounds

    • get

      public byte get(int index)
      Returns the character located at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - the index where the wanted character is located
      Returns:
      the character in question
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the index is out of bounds

    • set

      public void set(byte character, int index)
      Sets the character located at the specified index to the specified value
      Parameters:
      character - the value to write at the index location
      index - the location of the character to write
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the index is out of bounds, or if the specified character is illegal for the game

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns:
      the number of useful characters (that means NOT including the 0x50 delimiter).

    • fromString

      public abstract void fromString(String string)
      Replaces all the string's characters from the regular Java String given as parameter
      Parameters:
      string - the String to read from
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given string contains characters that aren't in the game

    • stringLength

      public static int stringLength(byte[] string)
      Returns the number of characters in the given array (excluding delimiter). It's mostly made for strings that contain a 0x50 delimiter, as otherwise it just returns the length of the array.
      Parameters:
      string - An array of encoded characters that the method will count.
      Returns:
      the number of characters

    • toArray

      public byte[] toArray()
      Returns:
      A byte array that based on this string, ended with a 0x50 delimiter.
